title: /search
text:
can  we pass an additional intent attribute called "require", the value for this attribute would one of these enums: 

items, categories , providers.  

this will enable 
1. bytes transferred as needed for  bap ui. 
2. drill down kind of ui.

while this is possible using intent tags but that  could cause divergence between networks/directories. 

@ravi-prakash-v @pramodkvarma
author: venkatramanm

title: Why have select api at all?
text:
A possible flow:

Search, keep making cart locally in bap, then call init with all selections , keep doing negotiations if required and close out with  confirm.

Is select really serving any use when init /on_init is sufficient

Any way select is an incomplete order for which data is being sent back and forth between platforms with not much benefit. 


Am I missing any thing? 

I see  advantages in dropping select. 
1. Less network chatter.
2. Less confusing as this question is raised in many domains and in mobility, select is already skipped. 
3. Also confusions on where to do negotiation is resolved.
author: venkatramanm

title: BAP Module not comes UP
text:
Hi All,
We are deploying Beckon Onix on On-prime servers, and we are using Open SSL for Development. After deployment the BAP does not come
![Capture](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f97f6f23-7ecb-4924-a94e-7154c9edbcf9)
 up and not able to register with Open SSL key
author: jsatheeshkss

title: vulnerabilities
text: With the master branch, while running npm install, I get 13 vulnerabilities which do not get fixed with audit fix. any suggestions?
author: haribole

title: üì¢ Deprecation Notice: End of Support for Beckn ONIX master Branch from June 20, 2025
text:
Hi everyone,

We would like to inform you that support for the master branch of Beckn ONIX will officially end on June 20, 2025.

**üõë What This Means**
After this date, the master branch will no longer receive updates, fixes, or security patches.

Any further development or maintenance efforts will not include this branch.

**‚úÖ Recommended Action**
We encourage all users, contributors, and partners to transition to the new and improved version of Beckn ONIX, which has been developed and reflects significant architectural and performance enhancements.

**You can find the new version here:**
üîó [beckn-onix-v1.0-develop branch](https://github.com/beckn/beckn-onix/tree/beckn-onix-v1.0-develop)


üìå Next Steps
1. If you're currently using the master branch:
2. Plan your migration before June 20, 2025.
3. Review the changelog and migration notes (to be pinned shortly in the beckn-onix-v1.0-develop branch).
4. Open issues or discussions in the new branch if you need help transitioning.
5. Thank you for your continued support and contributions!

‚Äî The Beckn ONIX Team
author: emmayank
